required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Aclidinium Bromide Administered in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of multiple doses of inhaled aclidinium bromide in moderate to severe COPD patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalised Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 0-12 hr at Day 15 on Treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalised Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 12-24hr at Day 15 on Treatment
Change From Baseline in Normalised Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 0-24 hr at Day 15 on Treatment

Change From Baseline in Normalised Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 0-24 hr at Day 1 on Treatment

arm_group.description: Aclidinium bromide 400 μg twice-daily by inhalation

intervention.description: Aclidinium bromide 400 μg twice-daily via inhalation by the Eklira Genuair® inhaler: 1 puff in the morning and evening for 15 days.
Tiotropium 18 μg once-daily via inhalation by Handihaler® dry powder inhaler: 1 puff in the morning for 15 days.
Inhaled placebo: 1 puff in the morning (placebo to tiotropium) or in the morning and evening (placebo to aclidnium) for 15 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male and female patients aged 40 with stable moderate to severe COPD (GOLD guidelines).
- Post-salbutamol (FEV1) < 80% and ≥ 30% of predicted normal value and Post-salbutamol FEV1/FVC < 70%.
- Current or ex smokers of 10 pack-years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with no history or current diagnosis of asthma.
- No evidence of an exacerbation within 6 weeks prior to the screening visit.
- No evidence of clinically significant respiratory and/or cardiovascular conditions or laboratory abnormalities.
- No contraindication to use of anticholinergic drugs such as known symptomatic prostatic hypertrophy, bladder neck obstruction or narrow-angle glaucoma.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 2 sites in Germany. The first patient was screened in Mar 2009 and the last patient visit was in Jul 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible patients had at least a 5-day run-in period (and a maximum of 9 days) to assess patient’s clinical stability.

group.title: Aclidinium 400 μg BID - Placebo - Tiotropium 18 μg
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Aclidinium 400 μg BID - Tiotropium 18 μg - Placebo
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Tiotropium 18 μg - Aclidinium 400 μg BID - Placebo
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Tiotropium 18 μg - Placebo - Aclidinium 400 μg BID
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the evening and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Placebo - Aclidinium 400 μg BID - Tiotropium 18 μg
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Placebo - Tiotropium 18 μg - Aclidinium 400 μg BID
group.description: The study consisted of 3 periods of 15 treatment days each separated by a washout period of 9 to 15 days. In treatment period 1, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 2, patients received 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of tiotropium from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of placebo from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler in the evening for 15 consecutive days. In treatment period 3, patients received 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler and 1 puff of placebo from the Handihaler® inhaler in the morning and 1 puff of aclidinium bromide from the Eklira Genuair® inhaler at in the evening for 15 consecutive days.

group.title: Overall Study Population
group.description: All patients randomized into the crossover study

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Normalised Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 0-12 hr at Day 15 on Treatment.
outcome.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) population; patients were included who took at least one dose of Investigational Medicinal Product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All the information related to this clinical trial is considered strictly confidential and is the property of Almirall. This information will not be given to a third party without the written consent of Almirall. Publication and/or presentation, whether complete or partial, of any part of the data or results of this trial will be subject to revision and written agreement between the investigator and Almirall.
